column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it. Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk. Noor wants to make coffee with almond milk. Noor sees the pretty cup fall from shelf.
column2: Does Noor think the milk jar has oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk.
column4: Noor thinks the milk jar has almond milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully. Zara believes that the painting is the work of a famous artist. A gallery visitor accidentally spills a glass of water near the painting. Zara does not observe the water spill.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night. Carlos thinks the water door is closed now. A group of big birds comes to the corn field. Carlos doesn't see the big birds in his field.
column2: Does Carlos think the water door is closed or open?
column3: Carlos thinks the water door is still closed.
column4: Carlos thinks the water door is already open.

column1: Harry is in his home on a cold day. Harry wants to make his home warm with a fire in the fireplace. Harry sees the fireplace is full of wood ready for a fire. Harry thinks the fireplace is ready to make a fire. A bird flies into Harry's window. Harry doesn't see the bird fly into the window.
column2: Does Harry think the fireplace is ready for a fire or does he think a cat is in the fireplace?
column3: Harry thinks the fireplace is ready for a fire.
column4: Harry thinks a cat is in the fireplace.

column1: Emily is on a popular island for a fun day. Emily wants to tie her boat to a big tree near the beach. Emily sees the tree is strong and big. Emily thinks the tree is strong enough to tie her boat to. A big fish jumps out of the water near Emily's boat. Emily doesn't see the big fish jumping.
column2: Does Emily think the tree is strong or broken?
column3: Emily thinks the tree is strong.
column4: Emily thinks the tree is broken.

column1: Lisa is at a big party with her friends. Lisa wants to play a song on her violin for her friends. Lisa's violin is in a clean and shiny case. Lisa thinks her violin is clean and ready to play. A clown comes to the party and starts to make balloon animals. Lisa doesn't see the clown making balloon animals.
column2: Does Lisa think her violin is clean or has juice on it?
column3: Lisa thinks her violin is clean.
column4: Lisa thinks her violin has juice on it.

column1: Billy is playing in his room with his toy cars. Billy wants to play a game where his toy gun is the start line for the cars. Billy's toy gun is standing up straight on the floor. Billy believes his toy gun is standing up and ready. Billy's mom calls him for lunch. Billy doesn't hear his mom calling him for lunch.
column2: Does Billy believe his toy gun is standing up or has fallen over?
column3: Billy believes his toy gun is standing up.
column4: Billy believes his toy gun has fallen over.

column1: Gina is in her garden with her white ball. Gina wants to play catch with her dog. Gina's ball is clean and white. Gina thinks the ball is clean and ready to play. A butterfly lands on Gina's hand. Gina doesn't see the butterfly on her hand.
column2: Does Gina think the ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Gina thinks the ball is clean.
column4: Gina thinks the ball is dirty.

column1: Dino is at a big party with his friends. Dino wants to share a big, thin cake with his friends. The cake is on a high table. Dino thinks the cake is on the high table. A big balloon pops and makes a loud noise. Dino doesn't hear the big balloon pop.
column2: Does Dino think the cake is on the table or has the dog eaten it?
column3: Dino thinks the cake is still on the table.
column4: Dino thinks the dog has eaten the cake.

column1: Wanda is in her room with her big book. Wanda wants to put a pretty stamp on a page to mark her favorite story. Wanda's stamp is new and sticky. Wanda thinks the stamp is ready to be used. Wanda's cat jumps onto her bed. Wanda doesn't see her cat jump onto the bed.
column2: Does Wanda think the stamp is sticky or wet?
column3: Wanda thinks the stamp is still sticky.
column4: Wanda thinks the stamp is wet.

column1: Felix is at a big car race. Felix wants to unlock his race car and start the motor to join the race. Felix sees that his car keys are in his pocket. Felix believes that his car keys are in his pocket. A graceful bird lands on the fence near the race track. Felix doesn't see the bird land on the fence.
column2: Does Felix think his car keys are in his pocket or on the ground?
column3: Felix thinks his car keys are in his pocket.
column4: Felix thinks his car keys are on the ground.

column1: Violet is in a beautiful garden full of flowers. Violet wants to take a picture of a big red rose. The rose is in full bloom and it looks very pretty. Violet believes that the rose is in full bloom. A butterfly lands on a nearby sunflower. Violet doesn't see the butterfly land on the sunflower.
column2: Does Violet think the rose is in full bloom or has the squirrel nibbled the petals off?
column3: Violet thinks the rose is still in full bloom.
column4: Violet thinks the squirrel has nibbled the petals off the rose.

column1: Kyle is in the park with his red kite. Kyle wants to fly his kite in the sky. Kyle sees that his kite is dry and ready to fly. Kyle believes his kite is dry and ready to fly. A little bird lands on a tree near Kyle. Kyle doesn't see the bird land on the tree.
column2: Does Kyle think his kite is dry or wet?
column3: Kyle thinks his kite is dry.
column4: Kyle thinks his kite is wet.

column1: Alice is at a fun park with her red ball. Alice wants to play catch with her friends using her red ball. Alice sees that her red ball is in her bag. Alice believes that her red ball is in her bag. A merry-go-round starts to play a happy song. Alice doesn't hear the merry-go-round song.
column2: Does Alice think her red ball is in her bag or with the dog?
column3: Alice thinks her red ball is in her bag.
column4: Alice thinks her red ball is with the dog.

column1: Oliver is at the beach, building a big sand castle. Oliver wants to make the tallest sand castle that he can. Oliver's sand castle is very tall and strong. Oliver believes that his sand castle is the tallest and strongest. A seagull lands near Oliver's sand castle spot. Oliver does not see the seagull.
column2: Does Oliver believe his sand castle is still there or has it been washed away?
column3: Oliver believes his sand castle is still there.
column4: Oliver believes his sand castle has been washed away.
